comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -127,3 +127,11 @@
 --- @field skipcol integer
 --- @field topfill integer
 --- @field topline integer
+
+--- @class vim.fn.getscriptinfo.ret
+--- @field autoload false
+--- @field functions? string[]
+--- @field name string
+--- @field sid string
+--- @field variables? table<string, any>
+--- @field vim 1

comment_data.body: This function always returns a list

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -127,3 +127,11 @@
 --- @field skipcol integer
 --- @field topfill integer
 --- @field topline integer
+
+--- @class vim.fn.getscriptinfo.ret
+--- @field autoload false
+--- @field functions? string[]
+--- @field name string
+--- @field sid string
+--- @field variables? table<string, any>
+--- @field vim 1

comment_data.body: Nope, the docs say that is `sid` is specified, only information about the script with ID `"sid"` is returned. There is even this example: `echo getscriptinfo({'sid': 15}).variables`
Hmm, the docs is wrong. When `sid` specified, it returns a list with a single item.
Oh yes you're right, I just checked the tests and it always returns a list. Fixing it.
uh duh Lua's 1-based indexing is getting into me.
